definition: to follow through/to carry through to the end
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
thorough/penetrating/to pervade/to pass through
to begin/to start/then/only then
end/finish

sentences.english: We should carry through the principle of plain living and hard struggle.
sentences.chinese: 艱苦奮鬥的精神要貫徹始終。

sentences.english: The past, present and future, are only illusions , however persistent.
sentences.chinese: 過去，現在，未來，無論怎樣貫徹始終，都是幻覺。

sentences.english: I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to the light I have.
sentences.chinese: 我不一定求成功，但定必言行如一，貫徹始終。

sentences.english: Mr. Bush keeps his stay-the-course strategy for the war in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 布希先生對伊拉克戰爭，堅守貫徹始終的對策。

sentences.english: I thank you for what you did, and ask you to stay the course. Applause.
sentences.chinese: 我爲你所做的感謝你和請求你貫徹始終。

definition: selfless/impartial
dissident/dissenting/dissent
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
ruler and compass (in geometric constructions)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
sectarian bias/parochialism
courage and resource
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to show off one's ability
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
disagreement/differing interpretations
